title: Video: Driver facing charges after doing doughnuts in dad’s pickup goes wrong, police say
author: John Waller
bullets: Local News The 20-year-old driver hit a bike path fence and then fled the scene, according to police.
By John Waller January 9, 2026 | 11:29 AM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Police in Milford posted a video of a pickup truck doing doughnuts in a snowy parking lot, with the vehicle eventually crashing into an adjacent fence.

title: Kayshon Boutte shares gratitude for Patriots, Bill Belichick after opening up about gambling addiction
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update Boutte, who was arrested for underage gambling and fraud charges in 2024, revealed this week that he went broke due to a gambling addiction in college.
Kayshon Boutte is in his third season with the Patriots.

title: Dave Portnoy and Ann Michael Maye review pizza in Needham
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Restaurants QB Drake Maye’s wife and internet baker Ann Michael Maye joined One Bite as a guest reviewer.
Dave Portnoy reviewed more pizzerias for his series One Bite.
Kayla Bartkowski For The Boston Globe The “Queen of Bakemas” joined forces with “El Presidente” to review the pizza out of a Needham deli for the popular series, One Bite.

title: One person dies in a four-alarm fire in Easton
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The fire initially came in as a medical call.
A four-alarm fire tore through an Easton home Thursday night, killing one person, according to the state Department of Fire Services.
Firefighters were first dispatched to 44 North Main St.

title: Here are all the New Englanders up for – and every local tie to – the 2026 Golden Globes
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Celebs Plus: the full list of nominees ahead of Sunday’s show.

Artists with strong local ties who are up for Golden Globes this weekend include (clockwise from top left) Amy Poehler, Ayo Edebiri, Alex Cooper, Rob Delaney, and Adam Sandler (here with "Jay Kelly" co-star George Clooney).

title: A woman was on ‘Naked and Afraid.’ Her boss allegedly accessed her uncensored photos.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News In a new lawsuit, Danielle Beauchemin also accuses her former supervisor of hiding cameras in the ceiling above her office to spy on her.
The Yasuni National Park in Ecuador's northeastern jungle.
Ecuador is one of the countries where Maine resident Danielle Beauchemin competed on the reality TV show “Naked and Afraid.

title: Hundreds march in Boston after ICE agent fatally shoots woman in Minneapolis
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “The violence we are seeing did not begin on January 7.
The only difference now is that more people are finally seeing it.
” Activists march in downtown Boston Thursday night to protest the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent.

title: Mass. man pleads guilty to wildlife trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The man consented to the civil forfeiture of more than 100 wildlife parts including orangutan and tiger skulls and jaguar skin, according to the U.
S.
Attorney for Massachusetts.
